review: I have an Amazon Fire TV, Roku 2, (2) Chromecasts and was previously an owner of an Apple TV. The Fire TV has been the most fluid device and has the nicest looking user interface of the bunch. I purchased it mainly to have all my apps in one such as Netflix, Hulu Plus, Plex, Crackle, Amazon Video/Music, etc. The app selection has been quite smaller than I expected and sometimes apps crash. It also has the options to download games, but the 8GB it comes with isn't nearly enough to have multiple games installed. It needs to have more storage or allow users to connect a hard drive. The controller is nice, small, and responsive with voice search and about the size of the Roku controller. I had to get accustomed to it's button layout because of the familiarity I had with my Roku, but that's not a huge deal. It's not perfect, but its a very nice streamer and seems to be worth the $99 pricetag.Also, if you're familiar with rooting android devices, then you won't have any problems sideloading apps such as the xbmc/kodi android apps and other apps not included in the Amazon App Store to get more value for your buck.If an new Fire TV were to be made, the storage capacity definitely needs to be upgraded and maybe the memory to make it a better device overall.
